thread.title: Alameda County Deputy Critically Injured In Bus Accident At Jail
thread.title_full: Alameda County Deputy Critically Injured In Bus Accident At Jail

author: CBS San Francisco
title: Alameda County Deputy Critically Injured In Bus Accident At Jail
text:
Alameda County Deputy Critically Injured In Bus Accident At Jail February 22, 2017 12:23 PM Filed Under: Alameda County Sheriffs' Department , Bus accident , Deputy , Dublin , Santa Rita Jail Investigation into vehicle accident at Santa Rita Jail that left Alameda County Sheriff's deputy in critical condition (CBS) 
DUBLIN (CBS SF) — A veteran Alameda County sheriff’s deputy is in critical condition on life support after being struck by a transportation vehicle at Santa Rita Jail in Dublin early Wednesday morning, a sheriff’s spokesman said. 
The incident happened at about 6 a.m. at the transportation yard behind the jail near Broder Boulevard, Sgt. Ray Kelly said. 
An investigation into the accident is being conducted, but no further details are available at this time, Kelly said. 
The injured deputy is being treated at John Muir Medical Center in Walnut Creek, where a large group of other deputies have gathered to support the deputy and his family, according to Kelly. 
He said the news media is not welcome at the hospital. 
The injured deputy has been with the sheriff’s office “for many years,” Kelly said.
